data.title: Tech Tuesday Picks: The top 7 low-code/no-code solutions for SMEs
data.author: Yajush Gupta

heading.text: Why insurers should be all about the data

paragraphs.text: via pexels
Yajush Gupta
January 28, 2025

Welcome to this week’s edition of Tech Tuesday! As SMEs continue to navigate the ever-evolving digital landscape, the rise of low-code and no-code platforms has opened up new possibilities for streamlined operations and growth.
These platforms allow businesses to build and customize apps, automate workflows, and boost productivity, all without the need for extensive coding skills.
In this edition, we’re highlighting seven top low-code/no-code platforms that can help SMEs scale efficiently, improve efficiency, and stay ahead of the competition.

Bubble is a powerful no-code platform for building complex web apps and marketplaces. It enables businesses to design, develop, and host fully functional applications with a user-friendly drag-and-drop interface. Ideal for SMEs looking to create customized web applications, Bubble supports features like database integration, API connections, and responsive design.

Airtable is a cloud-based platform that combines the simplicity of spreadsheets with the functionality of databases, making it perfect for organizing work and automating workflows. Small businesses use Airtable for project management and CRM solutions, taking advantage of its templates for various business needs, app integrations, and automation features to streamline day-to-day operations.

Zapier connects over 3,000 apps and automates workflows without any need for coding. It helps businesses integrate their existing tools and automate repetitive tasks. SMEs can use Zapier to set up custom workflows with triggers and actions, saving time and reducing manual work. It’s an excellent tool for businesses that rely on multiple apps and need to make them work seamlessly together.

Webflow is a no-code platform designed for building visually appealing websites without writing a single line of code. It’s especially useful for SMEs needing to create responsive websites or landing pages. Webflow’s visual design editor, CMS capabilities, and e-commerce integration make it a versatile tool for businesses focused on digital presence.

Microsoft PowerApps is part of the Microsoft Power Platform, allowing businesses to build custom apps to improve internal processes. It integrates seamlessly with Microsoft 365 tools such as Teams and SharePoint. PowerApps is perfect for SMEs already using Microsoft products who want to streamline workflows, automate processes, and build apps to enhance productivity without coding expertise.

OutSystems is a robust low-code platform used to build enterprise-grade web and mobile applications. It combines the flexibility of traditional development with the speed and ease of low-code solutions. OutSystems is ideal for SMEs looking to scale their apps while maintaining customization, and it supports integrations with multiple systems, making it great for businesses with complex needs.

Glide enables users to create mobile apps from Google Sheets without writing any code. This platform is perfect for small businesses that need simple, data-driven apps quickly. With a range of customizable templates, Glide helps SMEs create functional apps for tasks like inventory management, customer engagement, and internal tools, making it an excellent option for those looking for easy app solutions.
Keep up to date with our stories on LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook and Instagram.
Yajush Gupta
Yajush is a journalist at Dynamic Business. He previously worked with Reuters as a business correspondent and holds a postgrad degree in print journalism.
